The History & Future behind the spinning...

The sport originates from a time when spinning was associated with gangsters in South Africa. Gangsters from apartheid's racially segregated townships who stole cars to make ends meet and showed off their bounty by performing wild stunts in the streets. The sport reached the peak during the years 1980's.

The name "Gusheshe" nickname refers to BMW E30 hard-top 325iS. Manufactured between 1982 and 1994. The E30 series comprises a range of vehicles,
Recently the South African hip-hop scene has come out with tracks mentioning the cult classic, Cassper Nyovest had Gusheshe ft Okmaloomkoolkat and rapper Sheen Skaiz did Gusheshe Versace Freestyle.

We have a 21-year-old female, dominating the scene and competiting amongst the greats. Stacy-Lee May drives a pink 325. With all the great, at the age of 6-years-old as spinners is the youngest child has something to prove. Jean “Panjero” Kruger, 14 is not your average boy-next-door, is as boyish as they come but wait till he gets behind the wheel of his “Gusheshe” He joined the adrenaline-pumping township motor sport two years ago and has become the top spinner and leader of his team. The power to thrill runs in the blood of the Kruger boys. His 16-year-old brother, Austin “Powers”. This sport, enables us to keep child of streets and away from bad influences. The amount of competitions and price won like new king 'sam sam',
THE YOUNG STARS ARE ABLE TO HAVE A BETTER LIFE AND BRIGHTER FUTURE.
